isis.stitle: 8 SPEED, 9 SPEED, AND 13 SPEED TRANSMISSIONS EATON SERIES - REMOVE - COUNTERSHAFT BEARINGS

note.para: In the following instructions, the front and rear bearings from BOTH countershafts are removed. For removal of the mainshaft assembly from the case, it is necessary to remove the bearings from the right countershaft ONLY.

step1.para: Remove the snap ring from each countershaft rear groove ( Figure 137).

figure.caption: Figure 137. Remove Snap Ring From Countershaft Rear Groove

step1.para: From inside the case, use a soft bar and maul to drive the countershaft rear bearings to the rear and from the case bores (Figure 138).

figure.caption: Figure 138. Drive Countershaft Rear Bearings to Rear

note.para: This procedure will damage the bearings and should not be attempted unless replacement of the bearings is planned.

step1.para: Remove the bolt and front bearing retainer plate from each countershaft ( Figure 139).

figure.caption: Figure 139. Remove Bolt and Front Bearing Retainer Plate From Each Countershaft

step1.para: Use a soft bar and maul to drive each countershaft to the rear as far as possible ( Figure 140). This will partially unseat the front bearings.

figure.caption: Figure 140. Drive Each Countershaft to Rear

note.para: The soft bar used should have a flattened end that is large enough so as not to damage holes for the roll pin and bolt.

step1.para: From the case rear, use a soft bar and maul to drive each countershaft forward to unseat the front bearings from the case bores and expose the bearing snap rings ( Figure 141).
Use a bearing puller or pry bars to remove the countershaft front bearings ( Figure 142).

note.para: The bearing inner race of models equipped with roller type front bearings will remain pressed on the countershaft.
